intro: Pavetta marlothii, commonly known as the marloth's pavetta, is a shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant typically grows in coastal and sandy habitats, often found in the Western and Eastern Cape provinces of South Africa. It features small, opposite leaves and produces clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. The fruit is a small, capsule that contains several seeds, contributing to its role in local ecosystems.
